title: Robert Oatley 2016 G-S-M (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a polished and tightly wound blend that is savory and meaty in flavors of tart cranberry, hoisin sauce and cigar box. It's a medium- to full-bodied wine, wrapped in drying, chalky tannins, but ends on a fruity finish.

title: Ada Nada 2015 Valeirano  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of rose petal, red berry and underbrush emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, crushed raspberry and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

title: 50 Harvests 2014 Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Petit Verdot commemorates the number of consecutive harvests by the Scotto family of Steele Canyon Cellars. Candied red fruit gives it broad, lasting richness that lingers across the structured palate.

title: Adega Mayor 2016 Reserva do Commendador Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This wood-aged wine is deliciously spicy. Antão Vaz dominates the blend and lends both rich apple and citrus flavors as well as an opulent character. The wine is poised, balanced and is just ready to drink.

title: Attilio Ghisolfi 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Wild rose, red berry, new leather and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the way. On the taut palate, firm acidity provides the backbone for sour cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Au Contraire 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: While steely in acidity, this wine offers a counterbalance of fleshy pineapple and mango flavors. It finds a balance between both sides of the equation and also shows great integration with the oak.

title: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Meaty layers of wild strawberry, peach and cherry shine in this well-integrated wine. It's light in ripeness and entirely refreshing in acidity.
designation: Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of

title: Bedouet 2017 Clos des Grands Primos Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: From a single vineyard, this rich wine balances acidity, concentration, ripe creamed-apple fruits and minerality. The wine is generous while never losing its great crispness. Drink now.
designation: Clos des Grands Primos Sur Lie

title: Bergström 2016 Cumberland Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Cranberry and raspberry hold down the center of this blend, which serves as the entry point to the winery's extensive single vineyard portfolio. Citrus and herb flavors are well integrated, with just a hint of stem in the finishing tannins.

title: Bernardus 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: The 2016 vintage is strong for this well-established winery's Chardonnays, and this twist-top appellation blend is a more affordable way to indulge. Broad, fleshy aromas of ripe Asian pear, sea salt and nectarine tart lead into a rich palate that's rip with lemon and yellow pear but defined by penetrating acidity and decent tension.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Pommard Clone Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: A rose-tinged floral aroma opens this wine, giving way to a juicy expression of the grape that is velvety in texture and substantial in tannins. Black cherry and cassis flavors take on a liqueur-like richness, with a lingering tease of tobacco.

title: Ca' del Baio 2015 Vallegrande  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, cooking spice, leather and a balsamic note come together on this full-bodied red. The concentrated palate offers dried Marasca cherry, clove and licorice alongside youthfully firm tannins and rather fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2029.

title: Canard-Duchêne 2009 Authentic Vintage Brut  (Champagne)
description: The crisp, mineral Chardonnay in this wine is keeping it fresh and still young. With acidity and tight citrus flavors, it has a dense texture that dominates the white-stone fruits, suggesting it should age a little longer. Drink from 2020.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Charles VII Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne)
description: One of the pair of prestige cuvées from this producer, this wine is full of ripe fruits, with touches of tannin as well as minerality. Extra time in bottle before release has deepened the wine's richness and introduced some secondary flavors. Drink now.
designation: Charles VII Blanc de Noirs Brut

title: Case d'Alto 2012  Taurasi
description: Truffle, underbrush, leather, prune and exotic spice aromas lead the nose. The palate has a firm structure, offering dried Marasca cherry, bitter cocoa and star anise, as well as hints of oak. Drying, fine-grained tannins provide support.

title: Castello di Verduno 2012 Monvigliero Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, chopped aromatic herb, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol lead the nose. The tight structured palate shows dried morello cherry, star anise, leather and clove set against firm, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins time to unwind then drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit. Drink after 2022.

title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Very easy-to-like aromas of lemon rind, lime pith and light apple blossom make for a refreshing and pleasurable entry to this bottling. There is great grip to the sip, where wet cement minerality meets with grapefruit-juice flavors.

title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Renelle's Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Labeled Willamette Valley, but entirely estate-grown McMinnville AVA fruit, this is a bit on the chewy, tannic side, but has plenty of blackberry fruit power as well. Barrel aging adds brown spices and coffee accents, with a vein of cola running through the finish.

title: Col dei Venti 2015 Tufoblu  (Barbaresco)
description: Leather, cedar and dark berry aromas lead the nose. The taut palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Crosby Roamann 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: Big in luscious flavor and ample body and ripeness, this white shines in pear, honeysuckle and vanilla cream, fermented and aged in neutral French oak barrels. It is fleshy and well integrated, with a moderate streak of supportive acidity.
